page.title: 07BERWICK CHURCH HISTORY
page.content: Church of the Holy Trinity Built 1652. Foundation stone APRIL 26th 1650. Charles ordered the building of the church, as existing church St. Marys was too small.Money was collected from churches all over England and Â£36 left from constrction of Old Bridge was used. The strong walls of Berwick castle were pulled down hauled in horse drawn carts and used to build the church. Coats of arms from the exterior of the castle can be seen above the gallery.A tower was planned but Oliver Cromwell on his way to the battle of Dunbar would not allow this as he did not approve of either Church Towers or Church bells. So this church has a flat roof. There is only one other church in England which was built in the same way.
